section.title: Practice hard disk devices
section.para: 1. Use dmesg to make a list of hard disk devices (ide,ata,sata,scsi) detected at bootup.
2. Use fdisk to find the total size of all hard disk devices on your system.
3. Stop a virtual machine, add two virtual 1 gigabyte scsi hard disks and one virtual 100 megabyte scsi hard disk. If possible, also add one virtual 200 megabyte ide disk.
4. Use dmesg (with grep) to verify that all the new disks are properly detected at bootup.
5. Verify that you can see the disks devices in /dev.
6. Use fdisk (with grep and /dev/null) to display the total size of the new disks.
7. Use badblocks to completely erase one of the smaller hard disks.
